Description: Yellow painted pottery shabti of Djed-Khonsu, a Priest of Amun with a worn head with the remains of a lappet-wig and crossed hands in relief holding black relief hoes; the front of the leg section is inscribed with a column of black painted Hieroglyphs; the flat back is decorated with a representation of a black seed-basket.
Condition: poor - head damaged, cracked at waist level
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore (?)
